name: Coq au Vin Blanc
ingredients: chicken thighs, bacon, shallots, mushrooms, garlic, white wine, chicken broth, thyme, bay leaf, butter, flour, salt, pepper
quantities: 2 lbs chicken thighs, 6 oz bacon, 6-8 shallots, 10 oz mushrooms, 3 cloves garlic, 2 cups white wine, 2 cups chicken broth, 2-3 sprigs thyme, 1 bay leaf, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, salt and pepper to taste
recipe:
1. Cook 6 oz bacon until crispy, remove and set aside.
2. Brown 2 lbs chicken thighs in bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
3. Sauté 6-8 halved shallots and 10 oz quartered mushrooms until soft. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Pour in 2 cups white wine and deglaze the pot.
5. Add 2 cups chicken broth, 1 bay leaf, 2-3 sprigs thyme, chicken, and bacon. Simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 30-40 minutes.
6. Make a beurre manié with 2 tbsp butter and 2 tbsp flour, and stir into the sauce to thicken.
7. Season with salt and pepper, and serve.
